alert.note: Alert for Colorado Springs Vicinity, Southern El Paso County, Rampart Range Below 7400 Ft; Western Kiowa County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 4:54PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Otero, southeastern El Paso, western Kiowa, Crowley and northeastern Pueblo Counties through 545 PM MDT... At 454 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout along a line extending from 12 miles northeast of Boone to near Crowley to 10 miles southwest of Wild Horse Point. Movement was northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph, and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Rocky Ford, Fowler, Ordway, Manzanola, Olney Springs, Boone, Sugar City, Crowley and Pueblo Depot. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Colorado Springs Vicinity, Southern El Paso County, Rampart Range Below 7400 Ft; Western Kiowa County
